title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 ยง 275.16 - Limitation of time for initiation of appeal
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 ยง 275.16 - Limitation of time for initiation of appeal

State Regulations

An appeal to the commissioner must be instituted within 30
days from the making of the decision or the performance of the act complained
of. The commissioner may, in his/her discretion, and at any stage of the
proceedings, dismiss an untimely appeal. The commissioner, in his/her sole
discretion, may excuse a failure to commence an appeal within the time
specified for good cause shown. The reasons for such failure shall be set forth
in the petition. Notes

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
